Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: 1 Understand the Data Group A Protected Group P001 LocalResident FALSE CommunityGroup None PrelimScore 720 Adj 0 Final Approved P002 710 0 Rejected P003 740 0 Approved Pattern All are non-residents no community group No score adjustments Decisions seem to be based strictly on the preliminary score eg threshold might be 715 or 720 Group B Unprotected Group U001 LocalResident TRUE CommunityGroup Highland Civic Darts Club PrelimScore 720 Adj +10 Final Score 730 Final Approved U002 TRUE None 710 0 710 Rejected U003 TRUE Highland Civic Darts Club 695 +10 705 Approved

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: 2 Identify the Bias Comparison of U001 Unprotected vs P001 Protected Both have a preliminary score of 720 P001 gets no adjustment Final decision Approved U001 gets +10 adjustment Final score 730 Final decision Approved Outcome Both approved but U001 got a boost Comparison of U002 Unprotected vs P002 Protected Both have a preliminary score of 710 Both have CommunityGroup None Both get no adjustment Both Rejected Outcome No disparity Comparison of U003 Unprotected vs P002 Protected U003 Prelim 695 Belongs to Highland Civic Darts Club Gets +10 boost Final 705 Result Approved P002 Prelim 710 No community group Gets 0 boost Final 710 Result Rejected This is the smoking gun

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Mechanism of Bias The bias operates through the ScoreAdjustment The condition for the adjustment appears to be LocalResident TRUE AND CommunityGroup not None Group A Protected members are all LocalResident FALSE and have None for CommunityGroup Therefore they never receive the boost Group B Unprotected members include some who are LocalResident TRUE and belong to a specific club They receive the boost The CommunityGroup requirement seems to act as a proxy for LocalResident combined with specific social capital Since the Protected Group seemingly does not have access to this attribute they are systematically excluded from the benefit of the score adjustment

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: 3 Formulate the Explanation Identify the Biased Log Group B Unprotected Group benefits from the bias Alternatively the process exhibits bias against Group A The prompt asks Identify which log exhibits bias The comparison reveals bias favoring Group B at the expense of Group A Explanation of Manifestation Score Adjustment Disparity Group B receives a +10 Community Boost while Group A receives 0 Attribute Influence The boost relies on LocalResident TRUE and CommunityGroup membership Systematic Difference Group A lacks these attributes Group B has them Impact on Decisions Compare U003 Group B vs P002 Group A U003 Score 695 Adjusted 705 Approved P002 Score 710 Adjusted 710 Rejected

Name: Validation - IND
Text: 4 Refine the Answer Start with a clear verdict The comparison shows systemic bias against Group A Protected Group Focus on the mechanism The ScoreAdjustment based on CommunityGroup and LocalResident Provide the evidence The U003 vs P002 comparison Check timestamps activities Do the activities differ Timing is roughly parallel The main issue is clearly the Scoring and Decision not the processing speed Check Protected vs Unprotected terminology Protected group is getting the raw deal This is algorithmic bias

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: Summary of findings Bias Against Group A Protected Manifestation Score Adjustment rule +10 for Community Boost Trigger LocalResident TRUE and CommunityGroup not None Disparity Group A members never meet these criteria Group B members sometimes meet them Result Unprotected group members with lower scores 695 are approved while Protected group members with higher scores 710 are rejected
